member_organisations:
HUNGART cooperates with the following professional organisations, however they are not members of our association: 
-    Magyar Alkotóművészek Országos Egyesülete (Association of Hungarian Creative Artists) / http://www.alkotok.hu/  
-    Magyar Képzőművészek és Iparművészek Szövetsége (Association of Hungarian Artists of Fine Art and Applied Arts)  
http://www.mkisz.hu/ 
-    Magyar Képzőművészeti és Iparművészeti Társaságok Szövetsége (Association of Hungarian Fine and Applied Arts Societies)
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Culture and media, Competition, Consumers, Culture, Education and training, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Single market, Digital economy and society
eu_initiatives:
- the exploitation of orphan works by public cultural institutions 
- Panorama-exception (including Wikipedia's current strategy relating to Freedom of Panorama)  
- negotiations of agreements and/or enforcement of rights against social media and sharing platforms 
- competition complaint against Google Image Search
organisation_name: Collecting Society of Hungarian Creative Artists Association Hungart (Hungart)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations

goals__remit: HUNGART was founded in 1997 and represents a little more than 900 Hungarian creators and copyright owners of fine & applied art work and photography. Its main goals are to represent the interests and rights of the visual artists as well as to perform the collective management related activities. As a CISAC member HUNGART also actively cooperates with the biggest European and American collective management societies in the field of visual art relating to collection of royalties and providing professional support to each other.
relevant_communication:
-    Cooperation with national museums on improving the legal use of images on behalf of end-users 
-    Extension of our international cooperation with CMO-s in the USA, in Europe and South-America 
-    Contribution in the implementation of the EU directive on CMO-s into the Hungarian national law
